subject.question: What is the effect of different amounts of chlorine on plant growth-large amount, smallamount, or no chlorine?

answers.answer: Most communities add small amounts of chlorine to drinking water to ensure safety for residents.
answers.author: Fredrik Backman

answers.answer: Typical drinking water does not contain high enough amounts of chlorine to truly eliminate beneficial microorganisms in the soil, thereby minimally affecting plant growth
answers.author: Abd al-Haqq al-Badisi

answers.answer: Beneficial microorganisms found in soil reproduce at such high rates, making the effects of chlorinated water nearly moot.
answers.author: Abd al-Haqq al-Badisi

answers.answer: Chlorine can kill beneficial microorganisms in soil, thereby affecting plant growth; however, most chlorinated drinking water is not concentrated enough to adversely affect plant life in a given area. This is due to the fact that the reproduction rate of microorganisms in the soil is so high that they tend to reproduce again before the plant can be negatively affect by the soil.
answers.author: Enid Bagnold

answers.answer: Chlorine also binds to the surfaces of soil particles, which reduces the chlorine's ability to destroy beneficial microorganisms
answers.author: Louise Bagshawe

answers.answer: Studies show that soil subjected to chlorinated drinking water only displayed a reduction in microorganisms in the upper 1/2 inch of soil.
answers.author: Paul Bailey

answers.answer: If enough salt accumulates in the soil and into the root zone, it may dehydrate the plant and impede plant growth.
answers.author: Latifa Baka

answers.answer: There are numerous forms of radiation, including gamma rays, which can hinder the seed germination, root growth and shoot growth of a plant, and ultraviolet, or UV, radiation from the sun, which helps to feed a plant after it has germinated and reached the surface of the soil.
answers.author: Anne Baker

subject.question: Which increases your heart rate more: walking up and down real stairs or using a stair-master?

answers.answer: Actually, if you tested that question, you will find that walking  up and down the stairs increases the heart rate much more.
answers.author: Deb Baker

answers.answer: they can go up stairs but its more of a walk with the front leg and jumping with the back.
answers.author: James Robert Baker

answers.answer: Walking up and down the stairs is an excellent replacement for walking. Both activities elevate your heart rate and, depending upon your pace, burn calories quickly.
answers.author: Kage Baker

answers.answer: In most cases, you will increase the intensity of your workout by climbing stairs because the act of lifting your legs to scale steps also strengthens your gluteal, thigh and calf muscles.
answers.author: R. Scott Bakker

answers.answer: Walking up and down stairs burns more calories than walking on a flat route at a moderate pace. Walking downstairs burns between 175 and 275 calories per hour, depending upon your weight. Climbing upstairs burns 530 to 835 calories per hour.
answers.author: David Baldacci

answers.answer: Whether you walk or run you are still lifting the mass of your body through the same height against gravity, so the amount of work done is equal in each case, but where the work is done in less time more power is required. Yes, you exert more power when you run up the stairs.
answers.author: Faith Baldwin

subject.question: Which type of container traps the most heat: a shoe box covered in aluminum foil, plastic wrap,or wax paper?

answers.answer: Aluminum foil is also used in cooking. It is used to wrap delicate and moisture sensitive foods like vegetables.
answers.author: James Baldwin

answers.answer: In addition to the above, aluminum foil is also widely used for insulation, i.e. for thermal insulation, heat conduction and electrical conductivity.
answers.author: Carol Ballard

answers.answer: Aluminum foil is also widely used to wrap leftovers, to help preserve the food.
answers.author: J.G. Ballard

answers.answer: Aluminum foil is essentially thin sheets of aluminium metal, generally less than 0.2mm thick. They are easily folded and wrapped around objects of any shape and size, making them useful in food packaging
answers.author: Todhunter Ballard

answers.answer: Cosmetics, pharmaceuticals and chemical products. Aluminum foil also acts as a barrier to light, oxygen, flavor, odor, bacteria and moisture. Long-life packaging that is used to package drinks and dairy products stored without refrigeration also make use of aluminum foil.
answers.author: Blue Balliett

answers.answer: Aluminum foil helps to retain moisture and hence vegetables and mushrooms will have more appealing texture when wrapped in aluminum foil before they being cooked.
answers.author: Mary Balogh

answers.answer: Plastic wrap is a thin film of plastic that is sometimes used to wrap and seal food items in a container in order for the food to be kept fresh for a longer period of time.
answers.author: J.G. Ballard
